intro: Eutassa cunninghamii, commonly known as the bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Eutassa cunninghamii is valued for its hardiness and ability to attract native pollinators.
